item.description:
As many of you know, EDEMG will be landing in Rio De Janeiro, Brazil, on the 28 of September to feast on Brazillian cuisine. Michelle has scouted transportation to our next destination - Buenos Aires, Argentina. From Rio, we'll travel by train through the towns of Santos and Curitiba along the southeastern coast of Brazil. From Curitiba, we'll travel by jeep to Iguassu Falls, on the border of Paraguay. From Iguassu Falls, we'll journey by riverboat down the Parana River into Agentina, finally arriving in Buenos Aires, with a lovely view of Colonia, Uruguay from across the Rio de la Plata (River Plate). Won't you join us for what I'm certain will prove to be a sublime culinary journey into South American cuisine!

As an added bonus, Michelle has agreed to a special dance performance should at least 20 EDEMG members attend dinner. Michelle has been taking ballroom dance lessons for several months now and has decided to pay tribute to the culture of Argentina by performing "Tango Claro"! This is a performance not to be missed!

Tango - the most famous of Argentinean rhytms, like Spanish "flamengo", it is played, sung and danced. Famous tango singers include:

Carlos Gard√©l (the most famous of all times was actually French by birth, but adopted in Argentina as a national symbol)

Julio Sosa

Tita Merello

Alberto Castillo

Susana Rinaldi

Please see the website for additional details. Please contact me should you have any questions or concerns.

Caminito Restaurant is owned by Luciano and Susan Sappia. They specialize in Argentina Cuisine Flavor Derived from Italy, Spain and French.

Dishes are made with prime cuts of meats, chicken and vegetables prepared on wood-fired grill. For a unique treat, try the Short Ribs (Tira de Asado), cut like you've never seen before, or the Spinach Crepes (Crepes de Espinaca) delicately prepared and very flavourful.

Appetizers include a grilled hard provolone cheese (Provoleta) Homemade Argentinean sausage or empanadas, a variety of tasty stuffed salty pastries.

All our dessert are homemade. Try something made with a special imported caramel sauce (Dulce de Leche), including flan and Sweet Crepes (panqueques).

Argentinean wines are abundant on the menu from an argentinean vineyard called Trapiche. Also popular Argentinean beer and sangria. There's also a wine sangria called Clerico.

The atmosphere at Caminito is truly argentinean and plans are to have live Argentinena music and dance featured in the future.

Caminito Restaurant is located at
7 Old South Street, Northampton

Contact Us at:
413-387-6387



For more information, see http://www.caminitore...

group.name: The Ethnic Dining Enthusiasts Meetup Group

item.name: A Taste of Agentina - Caminito Restaurante!
